intro: Poggea alata, commonly known as the winged poggea, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its distinctive wing-like structures on its stems, which give it its common name. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Poggea alata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions.
